meanings.definition: A person or thing that scares or frightens others.
meanings.sent1: The scarer jumped out from behind the tree to surprise his friends.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house had many scarers hiding in the dark corners.
meanings.sent3: The little dog thought the vacuum cleaner was a scarer and barked at it.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm was like a scarer, booming loudly and flashing bright lights.
meanings.sent5: The ghost costume made the child look like a spooky scarer.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism used to scare away animals or birds.
meanings.sent1: The scarecrow in the field acted as a scarer to keep the birds away.
meanings.sent2: The motion-activated sprinkler served as an effective scarer for the pesky raccoons.
meanings.sent3: The wind chimes worked as a scarer, creating spooky sounds in the night.
meanings.sent4: The fake owl on the roof was a scarer, deterring pigeons from landing.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights on the fence acted as a scarer, scaring off the rabbits.

meanings.definition: A performer who specializes in playing scary roles in movies or plays.
meanings.sent1: The scarer in the horror movie had a chilling presence on screen.
meanings.sent2: The theater hired a professional scarer to play the lead role in the thriller.
meanings.sent3: The actor joked that he was a scarer by day and a comedian by night.
meanings.sent4: The scarer's performance was so convincing that the audience screamed in fear.
meanings.sent5: The scarer's makeup and costume transformed them into a terrifying character.
